Html:
Hi,

I'm trying to use Dragon Naturally Speaking http://www.nuance.com/for-business/by-product/dragon/dragon-for-the-pc/dragon-premium/index.htm" as a voice command to control the navigation in my application.

In my app, I have a button of type G2DButton. Instead of click on this button, I can just use voice command and pronounce "Next". Dragon Naturally Speaking will click on the button for me. 

I have other c# app that I wrote having a button of type System.Windows.Forms.Button. This app is working ok with Dragon Natuarally Speaking. I also check other desktop application in windows and they all work with this voice command application.

I don't know if G2DButton need to implement anything else in other for it to work with this Dragon?

Anyone try this yet?

 

Thanks

If you can handle the event callback for your voice command from Dragon, then simply call the DoClick() method of your G2DButton instance. That'll do the click programatically. You can view through the UserManual and API reference to see what you can do using Goblin XNA.
